ovdesc.p: This file holds the system level parameters for the processing of Swap contracts.
The SWAP.PARAMETER file has a single record which defines the system parameters that control the processing of contracts.
This is the highest level file within the Swaps module and must be set up before any data can be entered into the module.
Only one record is permitted on this file and has the Id "SYSTEM".
The "SYSTEM" record consists of three major groups :
o Various "period" Category codes for Asset side.
o Various "period" Category codes for Liability side.
o Additional data concerning both sides. Eg. Transaction code to use on net payments, date and freq. of accruals, etc.

Specifies whether the value date (Payment date) for the schedules that fall on the maturity date should be updated with the next working day of the deal currency when the maturity date of the Swap contract is a holiday.

This functionality will be applicable only for the schedules that fall on the maturity date, provided DAY.CONVENTION in SWAP is set as Following/ Modified. In case of Modified, if the last day of the month is a non-working day, then the value date will be the previous working day (as per PRECEDING).
'YES' and 'NO' are the proposed values
Once the field is set to 'YES' then it will be No input field.

When swap contracts undergo the currency revaluation process, any change in the revaluation amount of the contract is posted as unrealised P & L, using the category specified in this field. A balancing entry is made to swap revaluation reserve using the category specified on the ACCOUNT.CLASS record SWREVAL.
This unrealised P & L is backed out when the contract matures.

This field specifies the profit and loss category code that is debited when brokerage is paid on a contract.

When brokerage is recorded on a contract the system credits an internal account number created with the category code in the ACCOUNT.CLASS record BROKER, and debits the profit and loss category code entered in this field (typically called brokerage paid).

Input must be a valid entry on the Category Code Table and the System Indicator must be PL (i.e. Profit and Loss).
